intro: Thymus praecox subsp. parvulus, commonly known as dwarf thyme, is a low-growing perennial herb native to southern Europe. It features small, aromatic leaves that are typically gray-green in color and covered in fine hairs. The plant produces compact clusters of tiny, pink or white flowers during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its compact size and fragrant foliage make it a popular choice for both ornamental and culinary purposes.
